headline: Corning (GLW) Is Up 18.5% After Securing Up To $6 Billion Meta AI Fiber Deal
summary: Corning Incorporated and Meta Platforms recently announced a multiyear agreement worth up to US$6 billion for Corning to supply advanced optical fiber, cable, and connectivity solutions to support Meta’s US data center expansion, alongside a manufacturing capacity build-out in North Carolina. Beyond its size, the deal positions Corning as an anchor supplier for next-generation AI data centers, tying its core optical technologies directly to Meta’s long-term infrastructure roadmap. We’ll now...

headline: US Stock Market Today: S&P 500 Futures Edge Higher As Fed Rate Decision Looms
summary: The Morning Bull - US Market Morning Update Wednesday, Jan, 28 2026 US stock futures are pointing slightly higher this morning, with E mini S&P 500 contracts up about 0.3%, as investors look ahead to a Federal Reserve meeting that is widely expected to leave interest rates in a 3.5% to 3.75% range. The key issue is the timing of the next rate cut, which markets are watching closely because it feeds directly into mortgage rates, credit card costs and P/E multiples. At the same time, private...

headline: Stocks to Watch Wednesday: Nvidia, SoftBank, Alibaba
summary: ↗️ Nvidia (NVDA): China has approved purchases of Nvidia’s popular H200 chip for the first time, giving authorization to several customers, including Alibaba (BABA, HK:9988). Nvidia shares rose in premarket trading, as did Alibaba's stock in Hong Kong.

headline: Corning beats Q4 expectations, stock falls
summary: Investing.com -- Corning Incorporated (NYSE:GLW) reported better-than-expected fourth-quarter 2025 results on Wednesday, but shares fell 3.6% premarket.

content.title: Corning beats Q4 expectations, stock falls
content.summary: Investing.com -- Corning Incorporated (NYSE:GLW) reported better-than-expected fourth-quarter 2025 results on Wednesday, but shares fell 3.6% premarket.

headline: Corning forecasts first-quarter sales above estimates on strong optical fiber demand
summary: Corning on Wednesday forecast first-quarter sales above estimates, boosted by resilient ​demand for its fiber‑optic products, which generate ‌nearly 40% of the company's revenue.  The Gorilla Glass maker, ‌a key supplier to Apple, has stepped up investment in its optical communications business as major technology companies race to expand data‑center infrastructure to ⁠support rising AI ‌workloads.  On Tuesday, Corning inked an up to $6 billion multi‑year deal with Meta ‍Platforms to supply fiber‑optic cables for the social media giant's AI‑focused data centers.

content.title: Corning forecasts first-quarter sales above estimates on strong optical fiber demand
content.summary: Corning on Wednesday forecast first-quarter sales above estimates, boosted by resilient ​demand for its fiber‑optic products, which generate ‌nearly 40% of the company's revenue.  The Gorilla Glass maker, ‌a key supplier to Apple, has stepped up investment in its optical communications business as major technology companies race to expand data‑center infrastructure to ⁠support rising AI ‌workloads.  On Tuesday, Corning inked an up to $6 billion multi‑year deal with Meta ‍Platforms to supply fiber‑optic cables for the social media giant's AI‑focused data centers.

headline: Corning Stock Falls After Earnings. It Can’t Extend the Meta Momentum.
summary: Shares of  Corning  fell Wednesday even after the glass maker posted better-than-expected quarterly adjusted earnings and sales.  The stock’s double-digit surge the day before may have set investor expectations too high.  The company posted adjusted earnings of 72 cents a share for the fourth quarter, surpassing analysts’ estimates of 71 cents, according to FactSet.

content.title: Corning Stock Falls After Earnings. It Can’t Extend the Meta Momentum.
content.summary: Shares of  Corning  fell Wednesday even after the glass maker posted better-than-expected quarterly adjusted earnings and sales.  The stock’s double-digit surge the day before may have set investor expectations too high.  The company posted adjusted earnings of 72 cents a share for the fourth quarter, surpassing analysts’ estimates of 71 cents, according to FactSet.

headline: Corning: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The Corning, New York-based company said it had net income of 62 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs and restructuring costs, were 72 cents per share. The results beat Wall Street expectations.

content.title: Corning: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: The Corning, New York-based company said it had net income of 62 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs and restructuring costs, were 72 cents per share. The results beat Wall Street expectations.

headline: Corning Announces Outstanding 2025 Financial Results (1) – Upgrades Springboard Plan for Faster Sales Growth on Significantly Enhanced Financial Profile
summary: CORNING, N.Y., January 28, 2026--Corning Incorporated (NYSE: GLW) today announced its fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results and provided its outlook for first-quarter 2026.

headline: Meta, Corning sign deal worth up to $6bn for US data centre expansion
summary: Corning will supply optical fibre and expand North Carolina operations to support Meta’s US data centre projects.

content.title: Meta, Corning sign deal worth up to $6bn for US data centre expansion
content.summary: Corning will supply optical fibre and expand North Carolina operations to support Meta’s US data centre projects.

thumbnail.caption: Corning expects the expanded operations to boost projected employment in North Carolina by 15% to 20%.

headline: Corning (NYSE:GLW) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q4 CY2025 Earnings
summary: Glass and electronic component manufacturer Corning (NYSE:GLW) fell short of the markets revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, but sales rose 8.8% year on year to $4.22 billion. Next quarter’s revenue guidance of $4.25 billion underwhelmed, coming in 0.5% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.72 per share was 2.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Corning (NYSE:GLW) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q4 CY2025 Earnings
content.summary: Glass and electronic component manufacturer Corning (NYSE:GLW) fell short of the markets revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, but sales rose 8.8% year on year to $4.22 billion. Next quarter’s revenue guidance of $4.25 billion underwhelmed, coming in 0.5% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.72 per share was 2.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Nasdaq Futures Rally as ASML Provides a Boost, Fed Decision and Big Tech Earnings Awaited
